value.title: Gartner: AI is moving fast and will be ready for prime time sooner than you think
value.excerpt: Companies have two to three years to lay the groundwork for successful use of generative AI, synthetic data and orchestration platforms.

value.title: Facebook developing machine learning chip - The Information
value.excerpt: Facebook Inc is developing a machine learning chip to handle tasks such as content recommendation to users, The Information reported on Thursday, citing two people familiar with the project.

value.title: Biobest Makes Investment in Robotics and Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: Along with Biobest’s $10 million investment in ecoation, the companies are also joining forces to develop new IPM-related technologies.

value.title: The Mind-Bending Physics Of Walking With Coffee May Save Humanity, For Now
value.excerpt: If you’ve found your fear of the robot apocalypse building lately, new research suggests humans will remain in charge as long as we’re the best around at one simple activity: walking with a cup of coffee in hand.

value.title: 3 traps companies should avoid in their AI journeys
value.excerpt: The industry is still in the early days of AI adoption, and organizations need to develop an adoption strategy specific to their organization.

value.title: The development of Bundesliga Match Fact Passing Profile, a deep dive into passing in football
value.excerpt: This post was authored by Simon Rolfes. Simon played 288 Bundesliga games as a central midfielder, scored 41 goals, and won 26 caps for Germany. value.title: Allianz backs AV8 Ventures’ second fund focused on AI technologies
value.excerpt: AV8 supports entrepreneurs developing artificial intelligence-driven technologies in the areas of health, mobility, enterprise and deep-tech.

value.title: This AI Makes Sure Your Data Center Is Always Up And Running
value.excerpt: CDS announced Nebula, a machine learning program for predictive maintenance, improving the management of data centers and IT infrastructure

value.title: Watson Assistant releases new features to help businesses transform customer service
value.excerpt: IBM’s virtual agent, Watson Assistant, is now available with an add-on option that is designed to connect to nearly every major contact center platform that uses the SIP protocol, including Genesys and NICE inContact, in as little as half an hour with no coding. Now, voice assistants built with Watson

value.title: Russia’s Yandex to start tests for Self Driving Taxis in Moscow
value.excerpt: Yandex is planning on starting field tests for its self driving taxis in Moscow, Russia. This would allow the people living in the Capital city to experience the future by taking a ride in the new autonomous vehicles later this year.

value.title: The best voice assistant
value.excerpt: Whether your voice assistant is the hub of your smart home, or simply a smartphone-based helper that tells you if it's raining, the best assistants streamline your relationship with technology.

value.title: iRobot's Roomba j7+ Robot Vacuum Uses Machine Learning to Avoid Pet Poop
value.excerpt: The company is offering a P.O.O.P. (Pet Owner Official Promise) guarantee that its latest robot vac will avoid solid waste.

value.title: Police are investing in facial recognition and AI. Not everyone thinks that it's going well
value.excerpt: A panel of experts warns that the growing use of technology in law enforcement agencies is starting a new wave of backlash from citizens and civil society.

value.title: AWS extends cloud computing curriculum to 21 higher education institutions in India
value.excerpt: Students in these institutions will learn about cloud architecture, data analytics, cybersecurity, artificial intelligence and machine learning.

value.title: Gates Foundation pours cash into British firm Exscientia to fight pandemics
value.excerpt: A British company using artificial intelligence for drug discovery has struck a $70 million collaboration with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to develop therapeutics to tackle the current and future pandemics.

value.title: JetBrains previews data science IDE
value.excerpt: JetBrains, maker of the IntelliJ Idea IDE and the Kotlin language, has launched a dedicated data science IDE, DataSpell, under an early access program. Accessible from jetbrains.com, the IDE was announced September 7 and provides a development environment for data science professionals involved in exploratory data analysis and prototyping of machine learning models.

value.title: AI-driven voice assistant PolyAI raises $14M round led by Khosla Ventures
value.excerpt: Conversational AI” startup PolyAI, based out of London, has raised $14 million in a funding round led by Silicon Valley’s Khosla Ventures, with participation from existing investors (Point72 Ventures,

value.title: Motorola launches in-car AI video system for police forces
value.excerpt: Motorola has made the M500 camera available for pre-order. It automatically captures footage from the backseat of police cars to ensure any incidents are caught on tape for a later review.

value.title: What Databricks’s $1.6B funding round means for the enterprise AI market

value.title: Wells Fargo applies machine learning, robotics to accounts receivable
value.excerpt: A new service offered by the company helps clients automatically capture payment and invoice information as well as make sure the information matches.

value.title: Money, mimicry and mind control: Big Tech slams ethics brakes on AI
value.excerpt: In September last year, Google's cloud unit looked into using artificial intelligence to help a financial firm decide whom to lend money to.

value.title: Database startup SingleStore raises $80M
value.excerpt: Database startup SingleStore today announced that it raised $80 million in a series F funding tranche led by Insight Partners, bringing its total raised to over $319 million at a post-money valuation “just shy” of $1 billion.

value.title: Machine learning is a great tool for cybersecurity, but be cautious, expert says
value.excerpt: Supervised and unsupervised machine learning are good ways to detect threats. But what's the difference? TechRepublic's Karen Roby spoke with Chris Ford, VP of product for Threat Stack, about supervised and unsupervised machine learning.

value.title: US government forms committee to advise on AI competitiveness, ethics
value.excerpt: The newly-formed committee will advise the President of AI matters. It's no surprise that artificial intelligence is the future. So much so that the Department of Commerce is forming the National Artificial Intelligence Advisory Committee to focus on a range of issues related to AI.
